title: Quick Tempeh Tacos with Cashew Lime Cream
directions: Add shallots and garlic to oil in non-stick pan on high heat, adding splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan, cooking for 2 minutes.
Crumble the tempeh with your hands into the pan and cook for 7 minutes, stirring until lightly golden and crispy. Continue to add splashes of water as needed.
Meanwhile, make the cashew cream by adding the ingredients to a food processor, and blend until smooth.
To the pan, add the spices and sauté for 20-seconds until fragrant, then add the diced tomato and soy sauce, cooking for 3-5 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat tortillas on a skillet and when the tempeh has absorbed the tomatoes to your liking, spoon it onto the warmed tortillas. Top with toppings of your choice, enjoy!
ingredients: Quick Tempeh Tacos With Cashew Lime Cream

I'm so excited to share this quick taco recipe with you! It can be adjusted to be as mild or as fiery as you want. It's hearty and loaded with flavour. The toppings are the "cherry" on top, so add something crunchy, creamy or spicy (or all of the above!).
Plate method: for many of our meals, we try to follow the plate method whenever possible to ensure that our meals are nutritionally balanced. Learn more about the plate method here!
We whipped up this cashew lime cream in no time at all. Pre-soaking of the cashews not needed! It adds just the right amount of tang to the tacos.
This also makes one fantastic taco salad!
Watch How To Make It Here
Quick Tempeh Tacos with Cashew Lime Cream
1/2 tsp chili powder (more if you like it spicy)
1/3 cup (85 ml) boiling water (add more if you like a thinner consistency)
